DOC.brief_summary: To compare the therapeutic and radiographic effects and safety between etanercept, methotrexate, and the etanercept/methotrexate combination in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
DOC.brief_title: Study Comparing Etanercept Plus Methotrexate to Either Etanercept or Methotrexate Alone in Rheumatoid Arthritis.
DOC.detailed_description: Etanercept is an injection administered under the skin twice weekly. Methotrexate is a tablet to be taken once weekly. Patients will not know which treatment they are on. Patients will need to meet the study criteria to be enrolled in the study and sign an informed consent.
DOC.criteria: Inclusion: Generally healthy of at least 18 years of age with active rheumatoid arthritis. Exclusion: A history or presence of clinically important medical disease.
